[TITLE]
<line: 5> UNITED STATES OF AMERICA,
<line: 6> Plaintiff,

[TEXT]
<line: 8> CRIMINAL NO. 17-32 (FAB)

[TEXT]
<line: 10> V

[TEXT]
<line: 12> MARISOL SOTO-TORRES.
<line: 13> Defendant.

[TITLE]
<line: 15> UNITED STATES' SECOND MOTION IN COMPLIANCE

[TITLE]
<line: 17> TO THE HONORABLE COURT:

[TEXT]
<line: 19> COMEs NOw, the United States of America, by and through the undersigned attorneys,.
<line: 20> and in compliance with Docket No. 24, in which the Court ordered the United States to inform
<line: 21> every four months whether Defendant is complying with the PTD requirements, very respectfully.
<line: 22> states and prays that:

[TEXT]
<line: 24> 1.  The U.S. Probation Office ("UsPO") informed the undersigned that the Defendant failed to
<line: 25> report. The last contact was on November 14, 2017. Today, the USPO contacted Defendant
<line: 26> and clarified that she had a duty to report. Defendant was under the impression that the USPO
<line: 27> would be contacting her and, as such, she had no obligation to report. The Defendant indicated
<line: 28> that she would be complying with her reporting requirements. Defendant has complied with
<line: 29> all her other conditions.

[TEXT]
<line: 31> WHEREFORE, the United States respectfully requests that the Court NOTE the United States
<line: 32> compliance with this Court's order at Document No. 24.

[TITLE]
<line: 34> RESPECTFULLY SUBMITTED

[ABANDON]

[TEXT]
<line: 2> In San Juan, Puerto Rico, this 26th day of February, 2018.  

[TITLE]
<line: 4> ROSA EMILIA RODRIGUEZ VELEZ 
<line: 5> United States Attorney
